definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: Babies tumble when they are learning to walk.
sentences.chinese: 幼兒在學走路時常常跌倒。

sentences.english: They can also be worse when walking barefoot or wearing flat shoes.
sentences.chinese: 光腳或者穿平底鞋走路也可能如此。

sentences.english: Most animals walking on four legs have long muzzles.
sentences.chinese: 大多數用四肢走路的動物口鼻部分都相當長。

sentences.english: Asimo can walk, climb stairs and recognize voices.
sentences.chinese: 阿西莫不僅會走路，會上樓梯，還會辨認聲音。

sentences.english: Later i try to walk my way back.
He has a special car because he cannot walk.
I thought of the early polar explorers as I braced myself for the walk.
sentences.chinese: 當我縮起身子走路時想起了早期的極地探險者。

sentences.english: This blind old lady relies completely on her walking stick to walk.
sentences.chinese: 這個瞎眼的老婆婆完全依靠柺棍走路。
現在開始進行下一步走路。

sentences.english: She walks like she is very sure of herself , very tall and proud.
sentences.chinese: 她走路非常有自信，趾高氣昂的。

sentences.english: Whu?because you walk more, a study found.
sentences.chinese: 有研究表明，穿着舒適的服裝時你更願意多走路。

sentences.english: His head poked forward as he walked.
sentences.chinese: 他走路時頭向前一伸一伸的。

sentences.english: How does Tony often go to school?
Did you know baby walkers don’t help toddlers learn how to walk?
sentences.chinese: 你知道嗎，學步車並無法教會孩子們怎麼走路。

definition: to take the car, bus, train etc
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
to fall/fig. to suffer a setback
to fall down/to take a fall
to take a walk/to go for a walk
to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
